Kentucky-UCLA basketball live blog

The Cats and Bruins tip off after UNC-Ohio State.

Top-ranked Wildcats blast Tar Heels
UK 84, North Carolina 70: What we learned
Sullivan | Poythress injury a challenge for UK

Kentucky-UCLA basketball live blog

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 3:59 p.m. EST December 20, 2014
Buy Photo

Kentucky's Willie Cauley-Stein scraps with UNC's Nate Britt for a loose ball in the second half as the Wildcats rolled past North Carolina 84-70 Saturday at Rupp Arena. By Matt Stone, The Courier-Journal Dec. 13, 2014(Photo: By Matt Stone / The Courier-Journal)Buy Photo

1 CONNECT 6 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Refresh regularly (or click here) for updates during the University of Kentucky's 3:30 p.m. Saturday game against UCLA at the United Center in Chicago.

11:24, 1H: Karl-Anthony Towns met a UCLA shot at its peak and threw it into the stands. Walking off the floor to the under-12 timeout, he shook his head while saying, "No, no, no."

The Bruins have done nearly nothing in this one, an even more impressive beginning than what ended up a total UK route of top-five foe Kansas earlier this season. It's a 26-2 Cats lead in Chicago.

About half of Verne Lundquist's calls about UCLA have just been, "Still nothing."

— Steve Jones (@SteveJones_CJ) December 20, 2014

12:17, 1H: Finally. On a difficult Kevon Looney layup, UCLA's on the board following an 0 for 17 start.

13:06, 1H: Two 3-pointers later, this is an absolute rout. Devin Booker hit them both, then added a runaway dunk. The second 3-pointer came on a smooth Tyler Ulis assist, which made the Chicago native's hometown crowd howl. It's 24-0. Wow.

Keep in mind, the second half is when UCLA was gonna be in trouble. No depth. Bruins down 24 to start, this could be a (bigger) bloodbath.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 20, 2014

14:05, 1H: UCLA still hasn't scored, but with the White Platoon on the floor, neither has UK. The Cats have missed their last four attempts, as the lead stands at 16-0.

15:50, 1H: Enter the second platoon. Aaron Harrison, who has the hot shooting hand, stayed in with guards Tyler Ulis and Devin Booker.

15:56, 1H: The score remains 16-0 to the under-16 break. UCLA's getting beat everywhere, but what stands out are 3 early turnovers and a 7-2 UK rebounding edge.

Kudos to the UK fan in his UK ugly Christmas sweater getting into the timeout gimmick on the floor.

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 20, 2014

16:30, 1H: So, UK's pitching a shutout. The offense is hitting on all cylinders. Already, it's 16-0 on Aaron Harrison's second 3-pointr. Timeout, UCLA.

Harrison has 8 points and Trey Lyles 4 to lead the Cats, who have hit 6 of 9 shots. The Bruins are 0 of 4.

TWITTER

Thomas Beisner on Twitter

18:27, 1H: CBS' team of analysts suggested this one could get ugly. Already, it is for UCLA. A Trey Lyles 3-pointer moved UK ahead 7-0, prompting an early Steve Alford timeout.

19:43, 1H: The 3-point streak will live on. Aaron Harrison, on an assist from his brother, opened this one by making the game's first shot.

20:00, 1H: UNC-Ohio State, which the Tar Heels won going away, ended at 3:11 p.m., so UK-UCLA will go off just a few minutes behind schedule.

The "new Blue" platoon (Harrisons, Lyles, Towns, WCS) have not hit a 3 this year. But, they hit 74% on their 2's. #BBN

— Cards & Cats Stats (@CardsCatsStats) December 20, 2014

PREGAME: It's the CBS Sports Classic, and there's no mistaking which teams are playing in a Saturday doubleheader. Giant logos cover four corners of the court at the United Center -- UK and North Carolina at one end and UCLA and Ohio State at the other.

While tipoff between the Cats and bruins is set for 3:30 p.m., it'll likely be later with the Buckeyes and Tar Heels finishing up beforehand. When we get a time, we'll relay it.

For now, check out some pregame reading: a preview featuring Chicago native Tyler Ulius (http://cjky.it/1APQfVF), a John Calipari Q&A (http://cjky.it/1AqHjb6) and more story lines (http://cjky.it/1vbJDxu).

Ants in UK jerseys have taken the court. Scoreboard says 17 minutes to intros. pic.twitter.com/ISJqtkdKiO

— Kyle Tucker (@KyleTucker_CJ) December 20, 2014

Probable UCLA Staters

G Bryce Alford

G Norman Powell

G Kevon Looney

F Isaac Hamilton

F/C Tony Parker

Probable UK Starters

G Andrew Harrison

G Aaron Harrison

F Trey Lyles

F Willie Cauley-Stein

F Karl-Anthony Towns
